Job Title: Model-Based Systems Engineer

Location: Monroeville, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Location: Monroeville, PA Job Title: Model-Based Systems Engineer (Hybrid)Career Level: PrincipalStatus: Full TimeJob Code: 07PEOEAnnual Salary Range: $108,360 - $169,044_______________________________________________

Job Summary
This position is for an experienced Systems Engineer to support Digital Transformation initiatives across the organization and at key suppliers. This individual will support progress on Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), development of virtual simulations of real-world entities, system requirements and architecture modeling, a transition towards both digitally captured requirements and product verification in virtual environments, as well as technical coaching / training both internally and at suppliers. A qualified candidate will bring MBSE experience to collaborate across diverse engineering teams in various organizations and across the product lifecycle from proposal through product development, delivery and sustainment.

Specific Job Responsibilities Include: Support the Systems Engineering Digital Transformation initiatives across the organization and within the Industrial BaseUnderstand and improve the state of preparedness for each department with respect to Digital Engineering and Systems Engineering, including modeling specification and review Coach, as needed, in the execution of projects using MBSE and specialized toolsCollaborate with identified department project stakeholders to create system models that accurately document the requirements and performanceAssist with the review and disposition of supplier generated models for compliance with standards/requirements and compatibility with other system/sub-system models Provide Systems Engineering expertise via consultation and training to BPMI departments and Tier-1 suppliers as departments determine the needs

Minimum Job RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in a STEM field with a minimum of 9 years of industry experienceExperience in digital engineering technologies with an understanding of the processes and tools available to create virtual representations of physical systems (models)The ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Energy security clearance is required

Preferred Job Requirements4+ years of systems engineering experience in an aerospace or defense industry positionMaster’s Degree in a STEM fieldExperience implementing MBSE projects and developing SysML modelsExperience with Modeling & Simulation tools such as Simulink and MATLABExperience with the development of new products that have electrical, mechanical, and software contentExperience with cyber-physical (hardware & software) modeling solutionsExperience in an Agile modeling environment Experience leveraging systems engineering expertise in presentations and training othersExperience collaborating on teams across companies to achieve a common objective

Why BPMI?Bechtel Plant Machinery, Inc. (BPMI) is a project engineering organization supporting the Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program. BPMI provides design, manufacturing, and supply chain management of the fabrication, testing, delivery, installation, and field support of nuclear power plant components installed in submarines and aircraft carriers. In addition, BPMI provides upgraded replacement components in support of refueling and overhaul activities, and aids in the ultimate storage and disposition of spent naval fuel. BPMI also delivers information technology and operational solutions to the Nuclear Navy, enabling them to fulfill their critical mission.




BPMI is a drug-free workplace. Candidates accepting a job offer will be required to pass a pre-placement drug screening and background investigation. As an employee, you may be required to receive and maintain a security clearance from the United States Department of Energy in order to meet eligibility requirements for access to sensitive information or matter. U.S. citizenship is a requirement for security clearance applicants. All employees are subject to being randomly selected for drug testing without advance notification.  BPMI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, genetic information, disability or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
